website_summaries.verdict: It may offer more space for gear and less space for water than some competitors.
pros: A comfortable, compact hydration pack that also offers 3 spacious storage compartments
cons: At 1.5 liters, this model has less hydration capacity than others we tested, and the waist strap is bulky

customer_reviews.title: Very small bag. Good value for the price if you just need to carry water.
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much room to carry anything else in the bag when the hydration bladder is full. Your wallet and phone will fit fine, but there isn't enough room for bulky keys, snacks or cameras. Having the waist strap for this can by a little overkill unless you use it for jogging. I mainly (used to) take this hiking and found the waist straps to be annoying when they hang down, and even more annoying when buckled. The bag itself is pretty short therefore the straps sit closer to your ribs rather than your hips. It works great for carrying water, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Bladder.  Sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Update: I got in contact with the company and they were AMAZING! I explained my exact situation and without any hesitation they sent me a new bladder. In addition they threw in a cleaning kit for my troubles. Greatly appreciated. I will definitely continue to purchase these types of products. Thank you! I had this bag about 40 days never used it once. I wanted to use it solely for OCR runs longer ones. So, the first time I used it was this passed weekend and the bladder leaked before my race even started.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Value City
customer_reviews.text: Can't be beat for <$30. Air drys quickly with no lingering smell (will change review if that changes). I do wish you could tighten the upper strap a little bit more to prevent bouncing, and depending on your height the lower strap being too tight may prevent your ability to take full/deep breaths, which in turn may cause the pack to move. The hydration bladder itself sits very comfortably on your back and does a great job holding ice cubes and keeping it cold. 88 degrees and 10k out in the sun and i still had ice left over in my pack after filling it 50/50. Value all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit right
customer_reviews.text: I didn't find this pack to be too comfortable. I tried it empty (no water in the pack) for a short run and it rubbed against my neck. I tried it again with water to attempt a long run, and it drove me crazy. Was rubbing against my arm and neck. I had it sinched tight and could feel it rubbing and bouncing. I have it 3 stars because fit can be different for different people. It's a high quality product, lightweight and the bladder doesn't leak. I was able to throw my phone, keys and chapstick in. Would've been able to add quite a bit more if I'd needed to. Some first aid items, food, gels, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Carr

customer_reviews.title: No chafing!
customer_reviews.text: The pockets are reachable. Zippers can be used with ease. Water pouch fits in bag perfectly. I'm a marathoner in training and I can fit my car keys, snacks, chapstick, and mace in the side pockets. My rain jacket fits in with the water pouch easily. The pack never feels bulky or like I'm carrying too much weight. I have ran 10, 12,16, 14,18, and 20 mile runs with this pack and I have not had any chafing yet! This is a HUGE plus! I am a petite person, the only complaint I have is that I have to tighten the straps so much I will have to tape them all down. Other than that I would recommended this product.
customer_reviews.author: Youngmomma 84

customer_reviews.title: Survived Tough Mudder
customer_reviews.text: Small and light wieght. Could use just a bit more pocket space. Straps adjusted perfect to prevent any extra movement from back when running and jumping. After only washing once bladder had no funny taste to it.Would have liked the hose to be a few inches longer in order to attach it on both shoulder straps. Used it in the NJ tri-state tough mudder, so it took a little bit of punishment. Cleaned of well in the washing machine air dried flat overnight. Would recommend this to someone starting out. You get more than your moneys worth with this pack.
customer_reviews.author: Lazaro

customer_reviews.title: Drinking tubing onlyworks., when holding it at a certain height over my kitchen sink...
customer_reviews.text: Item doesn't work as described. The only time I can get the water to flow naturally through the drinking tubing is when holding it at a certain height over my kitchen sink. I miss the return deadline by 3 freaking days!!!! So disappointed. Also, the lower side waist zipper pocket kept opening. Almost lost my credit card & key. In addition, because a lot of the reviews said their was a left over metallic taste, I mixed a solution of white vinegar & baking soda, & left in the bladder overnight. Still I experienced the same metallic taste.
customer_reviews.author: Infowiz

customer_reviews.title: Great pack! Great Company!
customer_reviews.text: My mom lives out of state, but comes to visit every few months to hike. Instead of carrying water bottles, I found this for her. It works great! The pack came with a 20% off coupon for their other products. The company sent me an email asking if I was satisfied to follow up and/or had any questions. And most importantly, my mom loves to hike with it! It's not the fanciest thing out there, but as a simple, starter pack, or for someone who doesn't need to carry a bunch of stuff, it's perfect for quick hikes!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Juracek

customer_reviews.title: This is a great combo.  The bladder is worth more than the price of both the bag and bladder!
customer_reviews.text: I can't give this enough stars. It is a great bag that fits very well. The included bladder is absolutely amazing. The bladder alone was worth the cost if the whole product. I've used it multiple times already without any leaks or problems. I own 3 other bladders and this is by far the best one. It requires little effort to get water and has the best locking mechanism to make sure you don't have drips from the mouth piece. I really can't give this bag and especially the bladder a good enough review. Bottom line: great bag for the price and the bladder is easily better than the known name brands I have.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Goforth

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect......
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Easy to clean and comfortable to wear. The extra mouthpiece hose is a little awkward, but not too bad. It would be nice if there was a hook or clasp to attach the mouthpiece to when it is not being used, but otherwise great. You are kind of forced to slide the hose back and forth through the cloth loop as you get a drink....pull it out..drink....slide it back away from your face when done. For the price I would buy this again and recommend it to others. Nice extra space for snacks, tools. Not enough space to fit your sweater if you pull it off mid-ride.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Loved this for day hiking
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect hydration pack for day hiking. I used it for several day hikes in Oregon and it worked perfectly to hold everything I needed for a day. Lunch, protein bars, cell phone, car keys and ID. You do have to rinse it well before using to get rid of the "plastic" odor which I assume would also affect the taste of your water as others have noted. I filled it with about 25% ice and then water to the fill line and it kept my water cool for the whole day. Highly recommend this over some of the more expensive hydration pack brands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ToughMudder Capable, Comfortable Enough You Forget It's There, Big Enough For More Than Just Water
customer_reviews.text: The pack is amazing and did a great job holding up for nearly four hours through a ToughMudder course of dozens of obstacles and over 10+ miles of trails/paths. The bag held up great, never shifted, and was comfortable the entire way even when sliding through mud, swimming in ponds, and running down trails and roads. The bag is awesome, has enough water capacity for most runs, and with the additional pockets and space makes a great all round bag for hydration and carrying snacks/gels/etc for refueling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pack, great reservoir.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and size. I can fit a small DSLR/lens combo in the bag. The chest and hip straps are a great addition to make this pack great for running, and the small pockets are great for snacks, keys, wallet, and a phone. It's not too sweaty against the back on a hot sunny day and the shoulder straps breathe fairly well. It's lightweight and feels durable. Love it for the price. When I arrived, the water reservoir had a tiny hold, but they sent me a new one that arrived within a few days and it's exactly what I needed. Excellent work.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Good pack overall, not much storage when bladder is full
customer_reviews.text: Overall happy with this pack, wish there was more storage however. I wanted a compact bag, but when the bladder is full you can't fit much else in here. Also, had the hose pop off the bladder when snowboarding which soaked my coat, be careful to turn the release button to a position that won't cause it to knock into anything/pop off.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value Hydration Packs
customer_reviews.text: We did a four mile hike with our new hydration packs today, on a hot, humid Florida hammock trail. They worked splendidly... The taste of the water was good, and the mouth pieces were easy to use... We could even drink while moving along the trail. I am only 4'11" and my husband is 5'9" but the hydration packs were so easy to adjust, they fit each of us very comfortably... With the weight evenly distributed, so our backs did not ache! Yay! We are extremely pleased, and we will be using the packs on trails in and around the Great Smokey Mountains National Park at the end of this month.
customer_reviews.author: Scout

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to get a good seal.
customer_reviews.text: The pack itself is fine. The chest strap is perhaps a little high, but it works. The waist strap is completely unnecessary; I have never used it. The pouch in the back is useful for holding small items. The material is high-quality and looks great after going through the washing machine. The problem is the bladder. It worked pretty well for the first few weeks. But then it started to leak at the screw-top. It was very difficult to get a good seal. You will have to repeatedly turn the bladder upside down and test for leaks before heading out.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 months, then broke apart at the seams
customer_reviews.text: Previously I gave this pack 4 stars. It has great storage space, lots of pouches, zippers that are easy to access when in motion. It worked great...for 3 months. Now, after 3 months of light-to-moderate use it's basically tearing apart at the seams. I'm not sure it will survive another run, since the right strap has almost severed from the pack itself. Other, less important seams, are also ripping. I contacted the company 5 days ago to see if I could get a refund or a replacement, but I haven't heard back. I guess the next pack I buy will have to be a Camelbak. You get what you pay for. And I got 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Sheriff B

customer_reviews.title: Great pack, but sub par water bladder.
customer_reviews.text: I use this pack 3 times a week when I go out on bike rides/ run. It's comfortable, and has more than enough space to hold my spare tube, repair kit, tools, and pump. The harness fits like a glove, and has plenty of straps to get it situated how you like it. My only complaint is the waterpack. I've cleaned it out numerous times, but it still just tastes like plastic. It's not a subtle taste either. Apparently vinegar will help out with that, so I'll give that a go.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: The pack itself is great. It looks very well made and like it ...
customer_reviews.text: The pack itself is great. It looks very well made and like it will last a long time. The hydration pack looks like quality also. It just is really hard to get water to come out of the pack. I've had a couple packs like this before and never seemed to have a problem. I'm not sure why this one is like this. That's the only reason I took a star off. I can still get water out, it is just hard. My fiance can't get water out at all. Luckily it's my pack and she's got her own lol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bladder is fine and I didn't have any issues with it
customer_reviews.text: This is fairly cheap, so I didn't expect much, but the side pockets are a bit too small. I can't fit my phone or wallet in them. It's very compact so aside from the bladder, it can only fit flat things. The bladder is fine and I didn't have any issues with it, it seems pretty durable and the bite valve is easy to use and I haven't had any leakage. It would have been nice if it were a bit bigger so it could fit more things aside from the blade and an energy bar or two, but it's okay overall
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable value for runners!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small camelback which I cannot run with. This fits me well! I can run comfortably with it. I put my bearspray in those elastic cords on the back and clip it to the top with a carabeaner. I can also clip a flexible water bottle to the shoulder strap. I cannot believe this $19 product made my running life so much better. I thought I would have to spend $70 to get something that would fit comfortably. I'm 6'4" and slim.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Necessity if you hike etc
customer_reviews.text: I've used this twice. Just the hydration pack and its great. I used the hydration pack alone because the backpack was too small for my needs, but otherwise, this is great for everything from hiking to going out somewhere you'd be dehydrated. its super Easy to clean and thats the most important. Just make sure to give a good thorough clean to get rid of that plastic new taste.
customer_reviews.author: Lem

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: The seller for this product could not be more helpful and concerned. He first replaced my original order because it had a manufacturing issue. When I got the second one and took it on a mountain bike ride, I found that it worked perfect as a hydration pack but was lacking in storage space since it is necessary to carry tools, spare tube, etc. I sent him an email on that and he seemed actually pleased that I let him know so that he can look into improving that on future productions. As it is, it would be excellent for hiking, walking, etc. A very good buy for the money under any circumstance.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Well never own another pack without waist strap side pockets!
customer_reviews.text: Great hydro pack for the price! Bladder has held up well so far although the mouth piece cover not wanting to stay on is a minor nuisance. And threading the hose valve through the front strap loop can be a bit of a tight squeeze. What I like most though is the added waist strap side pockets that make accessing things like my phone and wallet/keys accessible without having to take the pack off.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap hydration pack, be careful washing it.
customer_reviews.text: Was a great pack through many (OCR) obstacle course races (including the spartan beast at mount killington VT). Even for the beast I managed to hold all my gear and fuel (it was a tight fit though). No good solution for the mouthpiece to keep it clean. When washing it, it was completely unravelled somehow (something got hooked) and I want to say it's my fault, but it wasn't my first time. Not sure exactly what happened, but it is destroyed now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: LEAKING BLADDER :(
customer_reviews.text: The bladder busted one mile into my second run using it....Talk about NOT HAPPY!....had to cut my run short do to not having an adequate water supply....I had read other reviews about this happening but decided to try it anyway BIG mistake....honestly I have since bought one at Walmart for a fraction of the price and it is holding up a lot better .... AGAIN NOT FUN RUNNING WITH A SOAKED BACK, BOTTOM, SHOES, AND SOCKS BEFORE YOU EVEN HAVE TIME TO START SWEATING!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: 8 months use so far and loving it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 8 months and I love it. It's comfortable and easy to adjust. I've used it for camping/hiking/biking and even just walking around fairs. It has just enough pockets to carry phone/keys/snacks/etc without being bulky. The bladder comes apart easily for easy cleaning. My ONLY complaint is that the lid to the bladder doesn't stay connected. So it falls off and I've lost track of it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Good for distance running
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a water pack for running so I could hold my fuel and phone and this worked perfectly for that. It was a little big for me, a lady. But I managed by wrapping the extra straps around the sides. The biggest complaint is on the bladder. It is REALLY hard to get dry and since I haven't used it now in a while their are mold spots and I'll have to order another. Other than that I loved the safety feature of the straw so water didn't leak and that it was long enough that I could change the length of the straw based on walking vs. running.
customer_reviews.author: Stepherslynn

customer_reviews.title: It was great! It held all my essentials
customer_reviews.text: Hi I used the Hydration Pack to compete in a hike-a-thon. It was great! It held all my essentials. I didn't feel any discomfort while wearing it for long. The bladder held up well. 😉 I've been using it over the last few days to attend sporting events. It's really ideal. Several persons were interested in it, and I gladly recommended it to them. I plan to take it on my runs and on future hikes. It's definitely NOT going in the closet!
customer_reviews.author: Lela Lu

customer_reviews.title: ... pack on an 11 mile walk yesterday and I love it. I'm a small woman and can totally ...
customer_reviews.text: I just took my hydration pack on an 11 mile walk yesterday and I love it. I'm a small woman and can totally adjust it to fit, and my husband can wear it too. This pack is really high quality for the price. The customer service at Camden Gear is excellent. I had a very minor snag and was immediately contacted by the company co-owner with an instant resolution. Very much appreciated!
customer_reviews.author: Betty S. Sarver

customer_reviews.title: Every Camden gear I bought leaked. I do long ...
customer_reviews.text: Every Camden gear I bought leaked. I do long distance run in the weekend. The leaking forced me to abort my running. This one lasted about less than ten months, the bladder began to leak. I tried various ways to repair it, it wouldn't work. It seems to me that Camden can't fix this leaking issue, what a shame!
customer_reviews.author: Spemin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: The best hydration pack!
customer_reviews.text: This hydration pack was amazing! I brought it to a music festival last weekend and it pretty much saved my life! I stayed hydrated while dancing the night away and kept my friends hydrated too. For those people who say that it's difficult to suck the water out, you have to bite harder on the mouthpiece. Make sure you leave some air inside the bladder before sealing it up.
customer_reviews.author: James Soto

customer_reviews.title: Easy access pockets while running
customer_reviews.text: I finally got to use it! It is so much easier than hauling a water bottle around. it has an even weight distribution so you don't notice it. It took me a while to figure out how and where to bite on the mouthpiece and I will have to remember to get the air out of the bladder before I seal it up so it won't slosh. All the zippers are easy to get to while it is on your back, and the pocket in the center is nice for earbuds so you can run it directly up the back of your neck. No tangling. Definitely going to recommend to my fellow runner. Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: NTBrandy7

customer_reviews.title: Good for trail running and short trekking
customer_reviews.text: I was stupid enough to buy mine for a marathon only to realise later that I will not run with it. But it came in handy during my runs. The quality is good (didn't expect it from a $25 backpack) and the water system is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Yakov Pyatnitskov

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack! I use it for trail running in the hot AZ summer. It doesn't bounce hardly at all and is very comfortable to wear for hours at a time. My only complaint would be the mouthpiece. The slit where you suck the water out was so small I could hardly get water out. However I just took scissors and cut it open longer and that was the perfect fix. The only reason why I wouldn't give this gem 5 stars. Overall, I do not regret it at all and love it more than my super expensive other packs.
customer_reviews.author: am

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a unisex backpack but it didn't even begin to fit my female body. I'm 5'2" and average sized. The straps that come up over the shoulder would not lay flat. Instead the straps that should have rested against my upper chest gaped forward and outward, looking ridiculous. Plus there were all these overly long straps dangling about. I sent this one back and will look instead for one designed and sized for women.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebonnet

customer_reviews.title: awesome hydrate bag for price
customer_reviews.text: nice thick quality material, nice pocket areas, and just right size to hold water. Havent used it yet, but didnt bother me that straps were ling because they are easy to cut to give custom fit. However, chest straps are too big so wouldnt be able to use bag if that doesnt change but my husband said it should get tighter after I fill my hydration water bag. So, if it tightens up after waterfill, then I will reccomend this product but if it doesnt I would not reccommend because it wouldnt work for runners, which is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Mam

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Wanted a more stable and comfortable hydration pack with pockets for OCRs. Wore this the the 15k at OCR world championships last year. Exactly what I was wanting. The cap over the mouthpiece kept mud and crud from contaminating it. Extra pockets allowed me to have race fuel on course without getting in the way. Wasn't sure how it'd hold up for being so inexpensive, but was pleasantly surprised. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Luke

customer_reviews.title: I find myself having to bite this one just perfect and even the the flow is slow
customer_reviews.text: Few thoughts for improvement. 1. I have multiple camel backs, their water delivery device is much easier to use. I find myself having to bite this one just perfect and even the the flow is slow. 2. Some more reflective material would be good for a person like me who does evening runs. 3. The upper chest buckle sometimes is difficult to line up right. Other than that, I really have no complaints. It is way better than my waist belt I have been wearing and I wish I would have made the switch sooner.
customer_reviews.author: jemett3

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Got to a music festival and all it did was leak. It was a super hot day and no matter how I adjusted it, it leaked. Had to throw the pouch away because I didn't want to bring around a wet/soaked small back pack. Super pissed off. Luckily my friend had a name brand camelback so I didn't pass out from the heat. This could've been bad. Spend the extra money and get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Frasca

customer_reviews.title: The best hydration pack you have never heard of!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect pack for OCR EVENTS. Recently took it on the Virginia Super Spartan. It performed great. The waist belt and waist storage are designed just right. This pack is light and functional. This is feature packed for a minimalist pack. I looked at a lot of more expensive packs that included Bells and whistles that are just used to fluff the spec sheet. The skinny- bought it, used and abused this pack, with minimal clean up it looks brand new. It looks like Camden Gear put a lot of thought in to the design. I highly recommend! The next test will be the Spartan Beast. AROO!
customer_reviews.author: S. C. Bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: this pack worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: It was the first time using a hydration pack for running, so take this review with that in mind. However, this pack worked great for me. The chest and hip straps were helpful for cinching the pack tight so I wouldn't chafe and the extra pockets for carrying my phone and a nutrition were perfect. The bladder seems a little thin but worked well.
customer_reviews.author: HJ88

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to take the new to me hydration pack out to Old Rag Mountain recently consisting of over 10+ miles of rugged terrain hiking as well as a rock scramble. The bag worked out great and I am very pleased with my purchase! I stashed a granola bar in one of the side pockets and a headlamp in the other one in case it got too dark, overall a great pack for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Solid entry level water pack for OCR
customer_reviews.text: Ran the Seattle beast with this pack. Overall a solid product. Waist strap pockets provided enough room for quick access to fuel. 1.5L water pack has a wide mouth which made filling at a water station easy. It only went under water once, but was for a few minutes. The mesh seemed to allow adequate drainage. Straps are well padded and did not chaff, although waist strap clip wore a hole in my shirt. The only problem was the center pocket zipper kept working it's way open and I had to have another runner zip it back up on occasion. Oh, and some how I lost the bite valve so had to use the open/close valve to get fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: It took a little getting used to, as it's my first hydration pack. I had looked at some other competitors products before deciding to purchase this one. I thought the other guys were really pushing it, in terms of pricing. After reading the reviews on Amazon, I settled on Camden Gear. It's great! It carries exactly the amount of liquid I need for a long bike ride or hike in the mountains, with the added benefit of some storage pockets. Light weight and easy to use at a great price! I couldn't ask any more than that. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A Nies

customer_reviews.title: Good pack But
customer_reviews.text: Durable pack...Bought this for Spartan events but when practiced fully submerging it in water it builds up water in pouch from openings in the shoulder straps. Other than that its a good bag. Latest update...After my first casual use the Thread from the chest strap unraveled a little. I informed Amazon Cust Svc and they offered me a full refund but optimistically i figured it would hold. After my 2nd use on another leisure hike while keeping in mind the strap being loose...It ripped open. Maybe redesign it with a stronger thread or sow pattern... Going to patch it up myself and hopefully it stays in tact..
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Best Hydration pack!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the hydration pack that I ordered from you. So much so, that I've ordered 4 so far, for myself and family members. I researched extensively on Amazon, and in my opinion, yours was the best one. First, my hydration pack had to be BPA free (which your's was). I also liked the design, the material, and the color (blue). I liked the 3 pockets and overall simplicity of the set up. And your customer service is outstanding! I will recommend your company and products to anyone in the market for a high quality hydration pack. - Charles Keegan
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES KEEGAN

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack
customer_reviews.text: Take this thing on hikes with me and lasts a very long time. My only complaint is that there isn't that much space in the backpack for anything else. If you are just looking to carry the water and maybe a couple energy bars and some sunscreen this will do. Bladder is great and the hose is the best that I've seen with these packs. Very easy to clean with the big opening. Overall it's a really comfortable pack and it's exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of space!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice has lots of space for small items I fit a money clip, keys, portable battery charger with 2 usb cables and phone in the front zipper pocket could fit more if I wanted and also in the top pocket that holds the water pouch has a separate pocket in it so I put a gatorade and a small handheld bike pump because it was not making contact with the pouch could fit more if I wanted with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Box Person

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: On my first trip with this pack the waist buckle broke - very cheap plastic construction. I like the design of the pack; however, the bladder inside does not function properly. Even under heavy suction and with the mouthpiece taken off, the water trickles out of the hose. There seems to be some sort of problem with the valve at the bag. Update: I was contacted by the seller and sent a new bladder that works. Crappy buckle aside, this pack works well for my Spartan races and cycling.
customer_reviews.author: curtis vandermolen

customer_reviews.title: Its Ok,,Not for runners
customer_reviews.text: It was my first hydration pack,,, it was decent priced but what I didn't like was its to hard to suck while your trying to breath when running...if your a biker,, or hiker then it wouldn't be a problem,,but being a runner I thought it would be better than carrying the water bottles,,Then theres the rubber bladder that holds the water...It can't be healthy..the chemicals in this left a bad taste in my mouth all day..."YES I washed it first. If I ever find a healthier bladder I will use the pack until then it sits in my closet
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Spartan Beast ready
customer_reviews.text: Fits well straps adjust for a secure hold. Only downside is excess straps that's why I rated it 4 stars. I'll have to either cut the excess straps or MacGyver a way to tuck all the excess straps away without having to constantly adjust UPDATE: The pack held up great at the NJ Spartan BEAST no complaints held my Gatorade, a ton of snacks and my gear. I never had to readjust the straps, no major chafing from bouncing and the mud washed right off. I'm very pleased with my pack!!!
customer_reviews.author: BrgnQn

customer_reviews.title: Best pack I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pack and I love it as much as the first ( which I mistakenly left out for my dog to enjoy). It's very low profile, has exactly the right amount of easy access storage and I think the 1.5 L is the perfect amount, not too bulky and just enough storage capacity to get me between water stations or laps at events. It also holds an extra advantage for Worlds Toughest Mudder as I can blow a little air into the bladder and it also serves as a floatation device after the cliff jump or other water based obstacles. I've never enjoyed running with a pack before but this one feels very natural on me. Chris
customer_reviews.author: chris g.

customer_reviews.title: Great pack, great price, only downfall is side pockets are difficult to reach while running
customer_reviews.text: I used this for an ultra trail race. I usually use a hydration belt but wanted something that stayed closer to my core and didn't bounce around. This pack was great. My only complaint was that I found it difficult to grab my gels from the side pockets while running because the placement of the pockets is closer to the back. If it had a pocket on the front strap or closer to the side/front on the waist strap I would rate it 5 starts. I will say, for the price, it's an awesome pack and would def recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: j.slaby

customer_reviews.title: One thing i don't like this hydration bag is the bite valve does not ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for snowboarding last season, it is cheaper than most hydration pack such as the camelbak brand. Not suitable for use in winter because it does freeze (forming ice at the bite valve connector to the tube) and water won't flow. One thing i don't like this hydration bag is the bite valve does not have cover, I don't like how it is exposed to outside and i have to put it in mouth without knowing it is clean or not.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Steups i need a refund!
customer_reviews.text: There were no instructions on how to use it included in the package. So I came on amazon hoping the reviews will show me how to mount it. Unfortunately my 1st use the water leaked all over the place wetting up my car seat.. I sucked the life out of the valve and didnt the get an ounce of water; though my car sear was totally hydrated!!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Overall looks nice, however mine arrived and there is not a ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall looks nice, however mine arrived and there is not a hole in the "bite valve" therefore rendering it useless. Not sure if worth returning or just slicing it open. I wonder if it will leak if i cut the mouthpiece myself to not have to deal with a return.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Lunsford

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It fits me perfect and I am a tiny lady. I have not used it yet but will for skiing, hiking, dirt bikes, motorcycle ect...I will also take the bladder out occasionally to fit other stuff if I don't need it. My boyfriend has a bag like this except it is much bigger, so I wanted a smaller one for myself. Now I don't have to shove everything in his bag when were out being awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Trista

customer_reviews.title: ... 10 miles and I must say the experience was great. I am 5'10" 190 and the fit was ...
customer_reviews.text: I used the CamdenGear hydration pack on a few hikes ranging from 8 - 10 miles and I must say the experience was great. I am 5'10" 190 and the fit was perfect. The pack was easy to adjust and the storage space was sufficient for the activity. In addition, I noticed the pack had minimal bounce during my run on parts of the trails. I am quite pleased with the purchase and would recommend this item for anyone who is looking to buy a hydration pack.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Betos

customer_reviews.title: Works well.  Good value
customer_reviews.text: This worked out really well for my run. I've never used one before so I had to write a review for newbies. The pack fits well and I like that it has a chest and waist strap. It doesn't jostle while you run. Stays firmly in place. Has cool side pockets. I'm not sure if I'll use the elastic straps but who knows. This is 1.5 L, which equates to about two 24oz sports bottles. For longer distances (marathon, ultras) you may need a larger bladder. Very comfortable straps.
customer_reviews.author: LB Run

customer_reviews.title: Great for Spartan race
customer_reviews.text: This is the first hydration pack I've ever purchased but i love it. I bought it for the Spartan Beast race and wore it for all 12+ miles and it was incredibly comfortable, no bounce, I forgot I had it on. Even full of water it had tons of room for snacks and gels and other essentials. I was able to fit a small jacket rolled up in the front straps and hauled that along. No leaks, water suction was fine, the bladder dried out after cleaning. I recommend hanging it upside down and stuff a paper towel in there. I will be using the pack again for the next race I have, I was very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Katie

customer_reviews.title: Able to explore new territory!
customer_reviews.text: I ran 11 on Saturday and 12 on Sunday. I endured new territory because I was not afraid of getting dehydrated. I could carry my phone and anything I might need. Great water pack. Never ran with one before but would highly recommend this one to any runner. Not one time did it feel cumbersome or heavy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: After 5 rides over the last 4 days, the pack fits very well, has just enough storage for mtb/trail ride essentials; and, after the first few uses, provides ample flow when needed. It took a few rides to get the water to flow well when needed. Not sure if that was simply user error or the bite valve just needing some time to flex a little better and "break-in." All said, I am very happy with my purchase and I would definitely recommend your product to others. Thanks for being so proactive in your requestd for feedback. Definitely assures you this customer will be on the lookout for future products from your company.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as a Camelback.
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend and I used these for three days at Ultra Music Festival in Miami. I honestly can't complain about anything major. If I were to nitpick it, it's a bit hard to suck water though the tube. Other than that they were pretty much perfect for what we needed. Just enough storage to carry a few things, and no buying water bottle for $5 a pop! These will be getting a lot of use this summer for hiking trips. Overall a very good pack for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Swedenburg

customer_reviews.title: Metal parts with rust.
customer_reviews.text: I really expected more about this product... the comments and rating were the main reasons why I picked this backpack. I bought 3 items, for me and 2 more friends. First, the fit, look and feel and functionality are great. The bags, compartments and hydration bag exceeded my expectations. After 8 months of use and maybe 12 long bike trips (average 20 kms) the backpack started to ruin: the elastic bands broke and the metal parts are with rust! Cant understand why this product made to carry water and constantly be exposed to sweat are not made stainless and rustproof?
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Alfaro

customer_reviews.title: I used it in the Spartan Super race this weekend at Vail Lake
customer_reviews.text: I used it in the Spartan Super race this weekend at Vail Lake, California. It worked great. My only thought, suggestion wise, while I was using it, was that I was concerned that the middle zippered pocket was going to come open and my phone would fall out. I tied the three zipper cords together at the top to prevent that from happening. Other than that, I thought the pack was great, it met my needs, and I'm looking forward to using it again soon!
customer_reviews.author: T. Pan

customer_reviews.title: Aside from the bite valve, great product.
customer_reviews.text: So far I’m impressed. The pack itself is a decent size with a enough zipping compartments for wallet/phone and even a snack. The stitching is even good. There are also reflective strips on the shoulders and back. I did a drop test on the bladder and no damage. My only complaint and what kept the last star is the bite valve. I had to take a knife and cut the opening because it came completely sealed. Otherwise very impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Iffy stitching.
customer_reviews.text: This was good for a few hikes and runs but after a while the stitching of the seams around the zippers on the side pouches ripped. I was not really that rough with the pack so it was rather unexpected. Other than that it was a nice pack while it lasted and remained stable and snug on my torso even when running.
customer_reviews.author: SD Funk

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how useful this is
customer_reviews.text: I just took it with me on a trip. It worked great and I'm very satisfied. The water has a bit of a plastic taste but I saw other comments mentioned that and it's not really a big deal. Either it'll go away with time or I'll get used to it. But for the price, I have to say the bag is pretty good quality and very versatile; I really like the pockets it has on the bottom straps which are perfect for keys and small stuff like that.
customer_reviews.author: Brandejo

customer_reviews.title: Extremely good value
customer_reviews.text: I specifically ordered my Camden gear pack to take with me to imagine music festival in Atlanta; let me just say that it was the perfect companion for the entire weekend. Like most people, I quickly became attached to it and took it with me everywhere. I used every pocket and laid on it to relax a few times and it kept me hydrated and happy for hours at a time. I'm a proud owner and I would recommend Camden gear to anyone! Thank you for a great product! -Lail Cothren
customer_reviews.author: Lail C.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Reliable Hydration Pack
customer_reviews.text: This hydration pack is exactly what I needed for some of my longer runs. This is the first one that I've ever owned, and I definitely recommend it for anyone interested in backpacking, long distance running, or any related activity. The backpack is adjustable, so it doesn't rub if it's adjusted properly, and the compartment that holds the water bladder keeps the water cold for about an hour to an hour and a half. Overall, it's lightweight, comfortable, and it meets all of my needs. I've only owned it for a couple weeks, though, so I'll have to see how it holds up after a few months of wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Summervile

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product, had to do a sewing repair on one of the shoulder straps within in first year of use (mountain biking) then used it for a few years before I just wore it out.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L

customer_reviews.title: Nice pack for mountain biking, walking or hiking.
customer_reviews.text: I received my new Camden Gear hydration pack and was able to use it this weekend. I really liked it. I liked the convenience of having water with me on the trail without having to stop and grab a water bottle. I also liked the storage capacity, the quality of the pack and the fit. I really like the pack. Thanks for a quality item.
customer_reviews.author: tkhutch87

customer_reviews.title: contact owner and i bet you'll feel good.
customer_reviews.text: The owner of the company for the product contacted me and told me if I had any question to email him and he will personally respond. Well I had a question about the bladder and he said he will replace anything that I feel unsatisfied with. I think he did a great job contacting me about it, also I ran with the backpack/Hydration Pack. fits so good and is so small that it's not uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Fitnesscrazy

customer_reviews.title: perfect for a theme park.
customer_reviews.text: excellent and works well. no leaks and if any one does say their bag leaks it's because they didn't tighten the valve connection to the bag. I loaded mine with ice and filled it with lemonade. used it for disney world, and day trips. the bag itself is not sturdy like a north face bag, but if ur just filling with water and you are gentle with it, then it should serve it's use.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Never drink out of public water fountain.
customer_reviews.text: I like to take water everywhere I go, gym, hiking, kayaking, concerts, on cruises and other long trips. Also I have quit a water bottle collection from 24oz to 40oz. Now no longer carrying a bottle or hooking it onto my daypack. This is great. I am 61 very active. Only problem is finding a bathroom. Wish I bought it sooner. Public water fountains I never drink out of.
customer_reviews.author: S.D.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain for the price
customer_reviews.text: Tried out the Camden Gear hydration pack today. Very nice pack for the price! The weight is good, the pocket placement worked well, and being a full-figured female I was particularly impressed with the comfort of the fit, especially the chest strap. I did have a problem with dripping from the mouthpiece - intermittent, so I'm not sure if I'm just not getting it closed adequately every time, or if there's a design issue. There was no leaking or dripping when I pre-soaked the interior overnight to prevent plastic taste in the water. Only suggestion for improvement would be to attach the mouthpiece cap to the straw line so it won't get dropped.
customer_reviews.author: M. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! The material it's made of looks very resistant, light weight, good size and fit. It is perfect for hikes, bike rides or running, because the size doesn't get in your way. The first time it had a little bit of plastic taste, but I read other reviews and took some advice on how to clean it in order to remove it. It is a great purchase, really happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Luisa Vega

customer_reviews.title: Just no.
customer_reviews.text: So cleaning the bag is beyond frustrating. There is a cover around the tube which is pretty much is next to impossible to take off. It smells and the cleaning is not possible so I am not happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed for long runs. It's small and lightweight and easily holds my cell phone, keys, and more. The side pockets along the bottom straps are great because I can access my fuel without having to take off the pack. The insulation over the tubing was a happy surprise. This is my first hydration pack, so it took me a few minutes to properly use the bite valve. Once I figured out exactly where to bite the valve, the water flowed very easily. My running friends now want this same pack!
customer_reviews.author: Chel

customer_reviews.title: doesn't feel too bulky and I really like the easy access side pockets for gels
customer_reviews.text: I have found that the 1.5L Camden Hydration Pack is just the right size capacity, doesn't feel too bulky and I really like the easy access side pockets for gels. I researched many different packs with the same bladder capacity and many of them didn't have a sternum strap let alone a waist belt. For the type of activity (OCR) I am doing I really needed the waist belt so the pack wouldn't flop up and hit me in the head. This pack stays on securely, provides the hydration and energy storage I need, is very comfortable and (a BIG plus) it was so reasonably priced. Thank you for making quality gear functional AND fairly priced.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gilly

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase - it's really good value compared ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used the hydration pack on a couple of runs and it works well. Very happy with the purchase - it's really good value compared to the bigger brand alternatives. The only minor disappointment I had so far is that the mesh pockets on the waist band are so far back (by my sides rather than at my front) that I'm not easily able to access the pockets while running. So while I had originally intended to store my phone in one of those pockets I've gone back to my trusty armband instead. But apart from that it's great and I'm very happy to be using it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ward

customer_reviews.title: Really loved the hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: Really loved the hydration pack. Very good.First time tested it in 21K trail run and it really did it well. Comfortable, plenty of room for stuffs, very easy to refill it with water, that is kept fresh. Excellent. Recommend it. I have to highlight the fact that the manufacturers do a very good post sale follow up, through e:mail MKT, to guarantee consumer's satisfaction. Positive action. Emphasizing my RECO.
customer_reviews.author: MAURO SATO

customer_reviews.title: great start, no endurance
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this thing, but I just couldn't. I liked the look. I liked the functionality. I liked the price. But it was all too good to be true. One of the waist pocket zippers broke on the first run (probably my fault for trying to force it closed while running). Then, the seams along the outer back pocket ripped loose. The bag is essentially unusable now. I brought this along for maybe four or five runs (~50 miles) before it crapped out. The water bladder worked great though.
customer_reviews.author: Kofuzi

customer_reviews.title: Love this pack
customer_reviews.text: Love this pack, had to wait to review since I wanted to use a few time to be fair in the review. Good storage for needed items, no leaks and it's very commfortable. Have used on hiking trails and cycling. Was worried about the bladder being smaller than others but have alway mad it home with water to spare.
customer_reviews.author: SJ. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great pack!
customer_reviews.text: The bladder is a good size, but is not heavy at all when it's on your back. I'm a small female, and it's very easy to carry. The mouthpiece is easy to drink from, and there's lots of storage space for your wallet, keys, phone, etc. Great alternative to expensive Camelbaks, with all the same perks! Highly recommend. My only gripe is that the waist strap doesn't tighten enough for me, but then again I'm pretty small. The chest strap makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Useful Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this hydration pack! It's easy to use, easy to refill, and super light. I didn't experience a gross plastic taste from the bladder, and the bladder itself is pretty durable. The mouth piece comes of pretty easy but snaps back on just as easily. Just be sure not to chew on the mouthpiece because it does get destroyed (though still funnctional) by chewing on it. The only thing that I didn't like is that it leaks from the mouthpiece while hanging down, so you must point it upwards while in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extra storage is really useful
customer_reviews.text: My son has been using this during his high school marching band practices and it works great. I like that it has a strap to keep it secure around his waist so as not to distract him during his routines. He has had friends ask him to hold their phones or other items since their packs do not have pockets. Would definitely recommend especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: sspence75tx

customer_reviews.title: There is not one thing he doesn't like about it and believe me he is very particular ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this pack for day hikes. We live in the Eastern Sierra and he really tested this product this past summer, hiking up to over 10,000 foot elevation. He also uses it when he goes jogging on our property. There is not one thing he doesn't like about it and believe me he is very particular and smart about products that he buys. Would highly recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sarten

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to my Camelbak
customer_reviews.text: I did receive my backpack. It is a gift to give but I have looked it over thoroughly and I like what I see. I own a Camelbak but couldn't afford that brand for a gift. I read the reviews for your product and decided to try it instead. I like the shoulder and. chest strap. It is for a large man and I think it will work well for him. The workmanship looks excellent. All in all, I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Gooding

customer_reviews.title: Good bag.
customer_reviews.text: No issue with delivery. Used for an obstacle race. Front zipper got caught on something during an obstacle without me knowing and broke off causing to loose my snacks. It could happen to anyone I guess. I don’t recommend using this for obstacle racing. Other activities yes.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: The back pack is nice though. Bought this for a rave just jumping ...
customer_reviews.text: The bladder can leak where it attaches to the hose if the hose is tugged away from the bladder all you water will leak out and youll have a wet butt ....The back pack is nice though. Bought this for a rave just jumping around was enough to make it leak. maybe if your just walking or biking it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: MrAllGrain

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I received the hydration pack today but I haven’t had the chance to run with it yet. The pack looks outstanding and I have to admit, I’m very impressed with the construction and the weight of it. To be honest, I wasn’t expecting much because of the price, but having worn it around the house and stuffing it with as much as I possibly can, I take back my preconceived notions. Thank you for an outstanding product! I’ll be singing your praises from now on. Thanks again!
customer_reviews.author: Tangowhiskey

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but was leaking
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and I guess worked ok, but it was leaking during the first time i used it.. was at an event and kinda ruined my clothes, then couldn't find anywhere to leave it.. Haven't found out why yet, but when you use it for the first time I would put a bag or towel at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, just maybe not for small items inside
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is very good. Pack fits me fine, I'm 6'4" (1.92m) and weigh 260 lb (120 kg). My only complaint (which is not a big deal) is that the storage compartment (there is a compartment for the bladder and one for storage) has a shape of upside down T. With that, small items, such as energy bars hide on the sides of the compartment, making them very difficult to reach.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Mendes

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: I took it mountain biking and it held up perfectly. No leaks it stayed cold with the ice. Only knock is the tubing isn't insulated so you get some warmer water until you drink enough for the colder water to come through but it's not that big a deal for me. It's a lot cheaper than other products and I think it works just as well and there's enough storage for keys, phone, snacks, and little tool kit.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: This thing would be great, except for the strong plastic smell and taste
customer_reviews.text: This thing would be great, except for the strong plastic smell and taste. I have washed it multiple times but can not seem to shake that smell and taste. NOT a terrible product, seems to be well made and the concept is excellent, just that "plastic thing" going on is not my cup of tea.
customer_reviews.author: cdb31569

customer_reviews.title: Cheap camel bak option
customer_reviews.text: The number of straps allowed me to adjust this to fit comfortably on my back. I'm 5'11 220 lbs. It holds plenty of water for a fully day hike. The hose and mouth piece do not drip. I made sure to add ice in the reservoir to keep the water cold all day
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Spartan Race tested
customer_reviews.text: I used this pack for two Spartan races this past weekend in Temecula, CA, where temps exceeded 97 degrees both days. This pack was a life saver. Kept my water secure, and survived all of the obstacles without any noticeable damage. I recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and fits well. Does not move around while mountain biking. Does what it is supposed to do and great storage for extra tubes and supplies. The hydration pack is awesome as well. Smells a little at first but goes away with repeated use and washings.
customer_reviews.author: Crash
